title: Defending champ Baez nears Rio history after SF comeback
description: Sebastian Baez continued his quest to become the first two-time titlist at the Rio Open presented by Claro by returning to the final. Match Report

Defending champ Baez nears Rio history after SF comeback

Fifth seed sinks lucky loser Ugo Carabelli, advances to ninth ATP Tour final

February 22, 2025

Rio Open

Sebastian Baez reaches his second consecutive final at the Rio Open presented by Claro. By ATP Staff

Sebastian Baez continued his quest to become the first two-time titlist at the Rio Open presented by Claro by returning to the final.

The defending champion at the ATP 500 averted a scare from lucky loser Camilo Ugo Carabelli to triumph 3-6, 6-1, 6-1 on Saturday evening. Baez produced an emphatic response to letting slip a break lead to lose the opener, winning 12 of the next 14 games to advance to his ninth ATP Tour final.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm so proud, because the last weeks were a little tough for me,‚Äù said Baez, who entered the tournament with just one tour-level win in 2025. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt feel very well this week, so I am happy to [have] recovered my body, my mind, my tennis‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm so happy to be in a new final here in Rio, it‚Äôs so special.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs always difficult to play some guys you have known since we were kids. He [Ugo Carabelli] is doing a very good job, so congrats to him and to his team. I‚Äôm happy with my level today, this week.‚Äù

‚Äî ATP Tour (@atptour) February 22, 2025

Ugo Carabelli, who was the eighth lucky loser to make an ATP 500 level semi-final since the series' introduction (2009), made a red-hot start in his bid to reach a maiden tour-level final. Yet the Argentine was unable to contain Baez, who reasserted his dominance in the encounter, drastically reducing his unforced error count from 15 to five between the opening two sets. In the decider, the Argentine opened up on return and expertly displayed his all-court prowess, finishing with 26 winners.

By advancing to his second consecutive title tilt in Rio, Baez is just the third player to reach multiple finals in tournament history after Diego Schwartzman and Carlos Alcaraz. In Sunday‚Äôs championship match, the 24-year-old will face either Francisco Comesana or Alexandre Muller.

With his run to the semi-finals in Rio, Ugo Carabelli is guaranteed to reach a career high on Monday as he is up to No. 69 in the PIF ATP Live Rankings. After defeating his countryman in back-to-back weeks, Baez now leads Ugo Carabelli 2-0 in their Lexus ATP Head2Head series.
